metadata.title: CVE-2024-42094 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/iucv: Avoid explicit cpumask var allocation on stackFor CONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK=y kernel, explicit allocation of cpumaskvariable on stack is not recommended since it can cause potential stackoverflow.Instead, kernel code should always use *cpumask_var API(s) to allocatecpumask var in config-neutral way, leaving allocation strategy toCONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK.Use *cpumask_var API(s) to address it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-48-generic - 6.8.0-48.48
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-48-generic - 6.8.0-48.48
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-48-generic-64k - 6.8.0-48.48
No subscription required
